org.jogger
Class StaticMiddleware

java.lang.Object
  org.jogger.StaticMiddleware
All Implemented Interfaces:
Middleware
public class StaticMiddleware
extends Object
implements Middleware

This middleware serve static files, usually from (but not limited to) the file system. Keep in mind the following when using this middleware:

  1. It will only handle requests where its path matches the prefix configured in the middleware (e.g. the request with path "/assets/my_asset.gif" will be handled if the path prefix of the middleware is "assets").
  2. If the path matches but the method is not GET, a 404 Not Found will be returned (i.e. it won't recognized other HTTP method different to GET).
  3. If the asset is not found, a 404 Not Found will be returned.
  4. If the asset hasn't been modified (i.e. using the If-Modified-Since header), a 304 Not Modified will be returned.

Author:
German Escobar

Constructor Detail

StaticMiddleware

public StaticMiddleware(String path)
Constructor. Creates a new instance with the provided path and with a FileAssetLoader as the AssetLoader implementation.

Parameters:
path - the prefix used to match the request path; also the path where the static files are located in the file system.

StaticMiddleware

public StaticMiddleware(String path,
                        String prefix)
Constructor. Creates a new instance with a FileAssetLoader with the provided path, and the prefix.

Parameters:
path - the path where the static files are located in the file system.
prefix - the prefix used to match the request path

StaticMiddleware

public StaticMiddleware(AssetLoader assetLoader,
                        String prefix)
Constructor. Creates a new instance with the provided asset loader and prefix.

Parameters:
assetLoader - the object used to load the assets.
prefix - the prefix used to match the request path.
Method Detail

handle

public void handle(Request request,
                   Response response,
                   MiddlewareChain chain)
            throws Exception
Description copied from interface: Middleware
This method is called by Jogger when a request arrives. Notice that the implementation has to call MiddlewareChain.next() to execute the next middlewares.

Specified by:
handle in interface Middleware
Parameters:
request - the Jogger HTTP request.
response - the Jogger HTTP response.
chain - an object used to call the next middleware.
Throws:
Exception
